lead_paragraph: “No one’s going to stop us” trading firearms through gun clubs and other markets, says one enthusiast who has long operated without a license, record-keeping or background checks.

byline.original: By HIROKO TABUCHI and RACHEL ABRAMS

snippet: “No one’s going to stop us” trading firearms through gun clubs and other markets, says one enthusiast who has long operated without a license, record-keeping or background checks.

headline.main: Obama’s Gun Initiative Seen as Having Limited Effect on Unlicensed Dealers
headline.print_headline: Obama’s Gun Initiative Seen as Having Limited Effect on Unlicensed Dealers

abstract: Gun industry has largely shrugged off Pres Obama's firearms control initiative; 2015 retail sales of guns is estimated $3.1 billion; some analysts say up to 40 percent more firearms might have been sold by small dealers through private transactions not subject to background checks.
